messages.subject: kids in cars
messages.msgSnippet: ... Disclaimer:  My son sits up front because of safety issues.  He can unbuckle his belt and unlock the door or crawl out the window too fast for me to catch
messages.messageBody:
> << I longed for her to ride up with me and hold hands and talk >>
>

Disclaimer: My son sits up front because of safety issues. He can unbuckle
his belt and unlock the door or crawl out the window too fast for me to catch
him. He's almost seven, VERY impulsive. That said, here's my story:

I was driving along, using my left hand; my right hand was just resting on my
seat. My son reached over and picked it up. I burst into a smile, my heart
swelled. Without a word, he gently placed my right hand on the steering
wheel.

Mary J


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
